channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Warner Bros. rejects Paramount's $108 billion bid
item.description: Warner Bros has formally rejected Paramount's $108 billion hostile bid.
item.content:encoded: Warner Bros has formally rejected Paramount's $108 billion hostile bid.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: GOP House Rep. says it's 'unacceptable' to allow ACA subsidies to expire
item.description: Rep. Mike Lawler says House Speaker Mike Johnson is correct in saying the health care system isn't working, but allowing ACA subsidies to expire without a plan to address rising costs is "idiotic."
item.content:encoded:
Rep. Mike Lawler says House Speaker Mike Johnson is correct in saying the health care system isn't working, but allowing ACA subsidies to expire without a plan to address rising costs is "idiotic."

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Group of lawmakers will be shown full video of controversial U.S. boat strike
item.description: Members of the House and Senate Armed Services committees will see the full video of a controversial U.S. boat strike Wednesday that Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth decided not to release publicly.
item.content:encoded: Members of the House and Senate Armed Services committees will see the full video of a controversial U.S. boat strike Wednesday that Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth decided not to release publicly.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Trump's rush to build nuclear reactors across the U.S. raises safety worries
item.description: A new program at the Department of Energy is pushing the development of nearly a dozen new reactor designs at breakneck speed.
item.content:encoded:
A new program at the Department of Energy is pushing the development of nearly a dozen new reactor designs at breakneck speed.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Trump's economic approval hits a new low at 36%, poll finds
item.description: A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll finds 70% of Americans say things have become too unaffordable and have a dim outlook on the economy and President Trump's handling of it.
item.content:encoded:
A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll finds 70% of Americans say things have become too unaffordable and have a dim outlook on the economy and President Trump's handling of it.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: How the long-running Obamacare fight came to thwart enhanced subsidies in Congress
item.description: Congress is poised to leave for a scheduled holiday recess without a solution for addressing the expiration of enhanced subsidies for Affordable Care Act marketplace plans.
item.content:encoded:
Congress is poised to leave for a scheduled holiday recess without a solution for addressing the expiration of enhanced subsidies for Affordable Care Act marketplace plans.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Congress set to go on recess with no answer for ACA subsidies, Trump and his allies back Susie Wiles after critical Vanity Fair profile, Trump's rush to build nuclear reactors causing safety concerns.
item.content:encoded: Congress set to go on recess with no answer for ACA subsidies, Trump and his allies back Susie Wiles after critical Vanity Fair profile, Trump's rush to build nuclear reactors causing safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Funerals begin for victims of Bondi Beach mass shooting
item.description: Hundreds of mourners gathered in Sydney, Australia, this week for the first funerals for the victims of the Bondi Beach mass shooting.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of mourners gathered in Sydney, Australia, this week for the first funerals for the victims of the Bondi Beach mass shooting.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Louisiana volunteer group brings groceries to families fearing immigration crackdown
item.description: A group of volunteers in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, delivers groceries to Latino families whose fears of immigration enforcement arrests keep them from leaving home.
item.content:encoded: A group of volunteers in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, delivers groceries to Latino families whose fears of immigration enforcement arrests keep them from leaving home.
item.dc:creator: Alex Cox

item.title: U.S. looks for countries willing to send troops to Gaza to maintain peace
item.description: After a ceasefire that has lasted more than two months, the U.S. is pushing for a lasting peace in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: After a ceasefire that has lasted more than two months, the U.S. is pushing for a lasting peace in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
